questions.question: The unconfined compression test is derived from

explanations.a: Unconfined compression strength cannot be found out by conducting a direct shear test.
explanations.b: Consolidation experiment is conducted to determine the settlement of soil in a confined environment.
explanations.c: Unconfined compression strength is a type of triaxial compression test where there is no lateral confinement to the sample and thus unconfined compression test can be derived from triaxial compression test.
explanations.d: Permeability test is conducted to determine the capacity of soil to allow the water to percolate through it.Direct shear test is used to determine the shear strength of soil. The failure does not occur at the weakest plane, it occurs at a predetermined plane where the horizontal plane is separated by two halves of the shear box.The test has  control over the drainage condition of soil. The test can be conducted on all three types of drainage conditions.
Permeability test is conducted to determine the capacity of soil to allow the water to percolate through it.
Permeability test is conducted to determine the capacity of soil to allow the water to percolate through it.

answers.a: In a direct shear box test , the plane of shear failure is predetermined
answers.b: Better control is achieved on the drainage of soil in a triaxial compression test.
answers.c: Stress distribution on the failure plane in case of triaxial compression is uniform.
answers.d: Unconfined compression tests can be carried out for all types of soil.

explanations.a: Direct shear test is used to determine the shear strength of soil. The failure does not occur at the weakest plane, it occurs at a predetermined plane where the horizontal plane is separated by two halves of the shear box.The test has  control over the drainage condition of soil. The test can be conducted on all three types of drainage conditions.

Direct shear test is used to determine the shear strength of soil. The failure does not occur at the weakest plane, it occurs at a predetermined plane where the horizontal plane is separated by two halves of the shear box.

Direct shear test is used to determine the shear strength of soil. The failure does not occur at the weakest plane, it occurs at a predetermined plane where the horizontal plane is separated by two halves of the shear box.
explanations.b: The test has  control over the drainage condition of soil. The test can be conducted on all three types of drainage conditions.
explanations.c: In triaxial compression test, the specimen fails at a weak point where failure in the plane is not forced. The stress distribution is uniform.
explanations.d: Unconfined compression tests are not carried out for all types of soil. It is not applicable  for cohesion less or coarse grained soil.

questions.question: If a cohesive soil is subjected to vertical compressive load, the inclination of crack to the horizontal is

explanations.a: According to the formula for the inclination for failure plane with respect to the major principal axis is α = 45 + Ø/2, for cohesive soil we know that angle of internal friction Ø is zero and therefore we get the inclination of failure plane or inclination of crack to the horizontal is 45°, hence 90° is the wrong answer.
explanations.b: According to the formula for the inclination for failure plane with respect to the major principal axis is α = 45 + Ø/2, for cohesive soil we know that angle of internal friction Ø is zero and therefore we get the inclination of failure plane or inclination of crack to the horizontal is 45°.
explanations.c: According to the formula for the inclination for failure plane with respect to the major principal axis is α = 45 + Ø/2, for cohesive soil we know that angle of internal friction Ø is zero and therefore we get the inclination of failure plane or inclination of crack to the horizontal is 45°, hence 63° is the wrong answer.
explanations.d: According to the formula for the inclination for failure plane with respect to the major principal axis is α = 45 + Ø/2, for cohesive soil we know that angle of internal friction Ø is zero and therefore we get the inclination of failure plane or inclination of crack to the horizontal is 45°, hence 38° is the wrong answer.

questions.question: The code book is referred for conducting the unconfined compression test is

explanations.a: IS : 2720 (part 1) -1991 covers the method for preparation of soil sample for various soil laboratory tests.
explanations.b: IS : 2720 (part 10) -1991 is the code book which covers the method for conducting unconfined compression tests in the laboratory.
explanations.c: IS : 2720 (part 3) -1991, this part deals with the tests conducted for determination specific gravity of soils
explanations.d: IS : 2720 (part 4) -1991,  this part deals with the grain size analysis of soils.

questions.question: Which of the following parameter is used to represent the unconfined compressive strength at failure

explanations.a: τf is the parameter which is used to represent shear stress.C is the parameter which is used to represent cohesion.
explanations.b: C is the parameter which is used to represent cohesion.
explanations.c: qu is the parameter which is used to represent unconfined compressive strength at failure.
explanations.d: Φ is the parameter which is used to represent the angle of internal friction.

explanations.a: According to the formula for the inclination for failure plane with respect to the major principal axis is α = 45 + Ø/2, for cohesive soil we know that angle of internal friction Ø is zero and therefore we get the inclination of failure plane or inclination of crack to the horizontal is 45°, hence 90° is the wrong answer.
explanations.b: According to the formula for the inclination for failure plane with respect to the major principal axis is α = 45 + Ø/2, for cohesive soil we know that angle of internal friction Ø is zero and therefore we get the inclination of failure plane or inclination of crack to the horizontal is 45°.
explanations.c: According to the formula for the inclination for failure plane with respect to the major principal axis is α = 45 + Ø/2, for cohesive soil we know that angle of internal friction Ø is zero and therefore we get the inclination of failure plane or inclination of crack to the horizontal is 45°, hence 63° is the wrong answer.
explanations.d: According to the formula for the inclination for failure plane with respect to the major principal axis is α = 45 + Ø/2, for cohesive soil we know that angle of internal friction Ø is zero and therefore we get the inclination of failure plane or inclination of crack to the horizontal is 45°, hence 38° is the wrong answer.

explanations.a: τf is the parameter which is used to represent shear stress.
explanations.b: C is the parameter which is used to represent cohesion.
explanations.c: qu is the parameter which is used to represent unconfined compressive strength at failure.
explanations.d: Φ is the parameter which is used to represent the angle of internal friction.
